name: Egg Fried Rice
description: Classic Asian dish, delicious and practical rice prepared with vegetables and eggs. Perfect as main course or side dish.

instructions.instruction: Break up cold rice with fingers, ensure no clumps remain.
instructions.tip: Day-old cold rice works best for proper texture.

instructions.instruction: Beat eggs in small bowl, add half the salt.
Heat wok or large pan over high heat until very hot.
Add 2 tbsp vegetable oil, let it shimmer.
Pour in eggs, let set 20 seconds untouched, then scramble into large pieces.
Remove eggs to plate while still slightly wet.
Add remaining oil to same wok.
Saut√© carrots and peas for 2 minutes.
Add garlic and ginger, cook 30 seconds.
Add rice, stir-fry constantly for 3-4 minutes.
instructions.tip: Rice should start getting slightly crispy and golden.

instructions.instruction: Add soy sauce, sesame oil, and white pepper. Toss to combine.
Return cooked eggs, gently fold in.
Add most of the green onions, toss one final time.
Garnish with remaining green onions and serve.

tips: Fresh rice is too moist - use rice refrigerated at least 4 hours.
Wok must be smoking hot - this creates 'wok hei' flavor.
Add shrimp or chicken for extra protein.
Use low-sodium soy sauce for healthier version.
storageInfo: Keeps 3 days refrigerated in sealed container. Reheat in wok or pan.
servingSuggestion: Serve alongside sweet and sour chicken or kung pao shrimp.
variations: Vegetarian: Add tofu cubes and more vegetables.
Kimchi: Add kimchi for Korean style.
